text: AIUI polyhedral-like codegen in MLIR still isn't quite at the level of something like Eigen. Hence why it's not used extensively in place of that for BLAS ops in e.g. TF

elements.text: AIUI polyhedral-like codegen in MLIR still isn't quite at the level of something like Eigen. Hence why it's not used extensively in place of that for BLAS ops in e.g. TF

text: I think a lot of it is that afaik MLIR doesn't give you sizes which you kind of need for maximum efficiency.

elements.text: I think a lot of it is that afaik MLIR doesn't give you sizes which you kind of need for maximum efficiency.

text: I'm pretty sure the affine dialect requires statically known sizes.

elements.text: I'm pretty sure the affine dialect requires statically known sizes.

text: As do many of the other dialects. Dynamic shape support is gradually being designed IIRC.

elements.text: As do many of the other dialects. Dynamic shape support is gradually being designed IIRC.
